title: Maerdy Lluest Wen Reservoir Walk Route

images.title: Alan Hughes / Maerdy
images.caption: View of Maerdy village from a path leading down from Mynydd y Ffaldau.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Lower reservoir in Cwm Rhondda Fach
images.caption: Lower reservoir in Cwm Rhondda Fach. The Rhondda Fach river flows through two reservoirs before passing by Maerdy. This is the second.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Weir of lower reservoir in Cwm Rhondda Fach
images.caption: Weir of lower reservoir in Cwm Rhondda Fach

images.title: Graham Horn / Afon Rhondda Fach
images.caption: Afon Rhondda Fach. The river has come down from the Lluest-wen Reservoir, the dam of which can be seen just below the skyline. A road from the reservoir follows the north bank. In the foreground is Pont Lluest-wen, carrying footpaths but not vehicles across the river.

images.title: Nick Earl / Pont Lluest-Wen Bridge
images.caption: Pont Lluest-Wen Bridge. Footbridge over Afon Rhondda Fach on the Coed Morgannwg Way Footpath

images.title: Eleri K / Waterfall on Rhondda Fach
images.caption: Waterfall on Rhondda Fach. This is downstream of Pont Lluest Wen

images.title: Nigel Davies / Lluest-wen Reservoir
images.caption: Lluest-wen Reservoir. The dam wall has a road crossing it. The water level does not reach the height of the wall pictured because it is only a thin concrete skin bounding the road. It is possible to walk from the pictured car park around the painted gantry above the top of the spillway.

images.title: Lleust-wen Reservoir by John Light, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lleust-wen Reservoir

description: This walk visits two pretty reservoirs from the village of Maerdy in Rhondda Cynon Taf. The walk starts in the village and heads north along the River Rhondda Fach to the Lower Reservoir. You continue north passing some lovely waterfalls before coming to the Lleust-wen reservoir. It's a beautiful spot with the pretty lake surrounded by attractive woodland and grassland. The last part of the walk runs along a section of the Coed Morgannwg Way, a waymarked long distance trail running through the area. You could follow the trail east to Dare Valley Country Park if you felt like extending the walk. If you were head north west you would soon come to the splendid viewpoint at Rhigos Mountain .
display_address: Maenllwyd, North Terrace, Maerdy, Rhondda Cynon Taf, Cymru / Wales, CF43 4DD, United Kingdom
